# Forsaken City/Collectables

From Celeste Wiki

< [Forsaken City](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Forsaken_City)

[Jump to navigation](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Forsaken_City/Collectables#mw-head) [Jump to search](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Forsaken_City/Collectables#searchInput)

**[Forsaken City](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Forsaken_City)'** s A-Side features 20 red strawberries, a golden strawberry, and one [winged golden strawberry](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Forsaken_City/Winged_Gold_Berry). Additionally, one crystal heart and one cassette tape can be found. This page is a guide on how to obtain each and every strawberry.

## Crystal Heart\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Forsaken_City/Collectables?veaction=edit&section=1) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Forsaken_City/Collectables?action=edit&section=1)\]

To first find where the crystal heart will be, follow the instructions for Strawberry 9, which goes as follows: in the room with two zippers, one heading right straight into spikes, and the other heading upwards, use the first zipper normally, jump onto the second one, and boost up-leftwards to where an "up arrow" sign can be seen. From there, head left, and continue through another (relatively harder) room with two zippers. Once you're outside of the city, and can hear the "Piano Only" version of _First Steps_, jump and dash left until you find the satellite, collecting the strawberry on your way.

A computer screen there goes through a specific cycle of colors: **white  • purple  • blue  • red  • purple  • yellow**. After that, several birds will start flying in different directions: the white bird will fly **up**, the purple bird **left**, the blue bird **down-right**, the red bird **up-right**, the purple bird (again) **left**, and then the yellow bird **up-left**.

Dash following the order the colors flash, in the directions the colors are associated with. It is easiest to do this on the platform a little left of the computer screen. Therefore, dash **up, left, down-right, up-right, left, and up-left**. Once that's done (there is no time limit, you just need to dash in order), a blue crystal heart will appear. Collecting the crystal heart will yield you the **Pointless machines** achievement.

## Cassette Tape\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Forsaken_City/Collectables?veaction=edit&section=2) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Forsaken_City/Collectables?action=edit&section=2)\]

Right at the Chasm checkpoint, move the block out of the way, and head to the other side of it. Head upwards and you will discover another room, one with paths towards strawberries 16 and 17. A zipper on the ground can be used to boost upwards; use that to make it up.

You'll find another room, with a zipper stuck on the wall. Move the zipper out of the way, and head behind it. This will lead you to a cassette tape room. Cassette tape rooms feature alternating blue and pink blocks, which alternate to a beat synchronized with an 8-bit version of the level's music. Time your jumps and make it to the cassette. This unlocks [Forsaken City B-Side](https://celeste.ink/wiki/1B).

## Strawberries\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Forsaken_City/Collectables?veaction=edit&section=3) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Forsaken_City/Collectables?action=edit&section=3)\]

### Start\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Forsaken_City/Collectables?veaction=edit&section=4) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Forsaken_City/Collectables?action=edit&section=4)\]

#### Strawberry 1\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Forsaken_City/Collectables?veaction=edit&section=5) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Forsaken_City/Collectables?action=edit&section=5)\]

[![](https://static.wikitide.net/celestewiki/thumb/7/75/Ch1a_1.png/800px-Ch1a_1.png)](https://celeste.ink/wiki/File:Ch1a_1.png)

Your first strawberry is found on the second screen of the subchapter, requiring you to jump up using the spring and dash upwards to reach it. Land on the ground, and there you go!

#### Strawberry 2\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Forsaken_City/Collectables?veaction=edit&section=6) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Forsaken_City/Collectables?action=edit&section=6)\]

[![](https://static.wikitide.net/celestewiki/thumb/8/8b/Ch1a_2.png/800px-Ch1a_2.png)](https://celeste.ink/wiki/File:Ch1a_2.png)

On the third screen; you need to jump off the block at the end of the room, collect the berry, quickly dash up to avoid falling into a spike pit, and grabbing up a wall.

#### Strawberry 3\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Forsaken_City/Collectables?veaction=edit&section=7) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Forsaken_City/Collectables?action=edit&section=7)\]

[![](https://static.wikitide.net/celestewiki/thumb/6/6a/Ch1a_3.png/800px-Ch1a_3.png)](https://celeste.ink/wiki/File:Ch1a_3.png)

On the fourth screen; this is a flying strawberry. To collect it, use the disappearing platforms at the right of the screen to jump upwards towards on top, and then jump off the left side to collect the berry. An alternative speedrun-specific strategy involves the use of [Wallbounces](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Wallbounces).

#### Strawberry 4\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Forsaken_City/Collectables?veaction=edit&section=8) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Forsaken_City/Collectables?action=edit&section=8)\]

[![](https://static.wikitide.net/celestewiki/thumb/7/73/Ch1a_4.png/800px-Ch1a_4.png)](https://celeste.ink/wiki/File:Ch1a_4.png)

The room after the flying strawberry, on your left, when you find a glowing light, go left. Hidden behind a small challenge, collecting this berry involves scaling up a small ice wall with a few spikes here and there. Dashing rightwards after falling down, at the left, will net you the berry.

#### Strawberry 5\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Forsaken_City/Collectables?veaction=edit&section=9) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Forsaken_City/Collectables?action=edit&section=9)\]

[![](https://static.wikitide.net/celestewiki/thumb/a/ab/Ch1a_5.png/800px-Ch1a_5.png)](https://celeste.ink/wiki/File:Ch1a_5.png)

Boost off the zipper left-upwards, and climb onto the right side of the ice block with spikes on top. Jump off upwards, and dash left-upright to collect the strawberry.

#### Strawberry 6\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Forsaken_City/Collectables?veaction=edit&section=10) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Forsaken_City/Collectables?action=edit&section=10)\]

[![](https://static.wikitide.net/celestewiki/thumb/0/0c/Ch1a_6.png/800px-Ch1a_6.png)](https://celeste.ink/wiki/File:Ch1a_6.png)

In the same room as strawberry 5, instead of heading upwards using the spring, which is how you would normally progress, head downwards, leaning on the right wall. An ice block can be seen: dash on it to destroy the block. In the room that follows, jump downwards, dash onto and hold the zipper, and jump onto it as it stops; subsequently jump to where the strawberry is. Jump off leftwards and dash up-left, through the floor, to get back to safety.

### Crossing\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Forsaken_City/Collectables?veaction=edit&section=11) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Forsaken_City/Collectables?action=edit&section=11)\]

#### Strawberry 7\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Forsaken_City/Collectables?veaction=edit&section=12) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Forsaken_City/Collectables?action=edit&section=12)\]

[![](https://static.wikitide.net/celestewiki/thumb/5/50/Ch1a_7.png/800px-Ch1a_7.png)](https://celeste.ink/wiki/File:Ch1a_7.png)

To reach this berry, instead of going to the right in the first room of crossing, go left into the room, and then dash into the dash refill and dash again, then climb up to the next screen. Jump over the first spring and jump on the second one, grab the wall and then jump above it, dash diagonally in the upper left corner into the refill and repeat the dash. You can also find [Theo](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Theo) right after the berry or when going left instead of up.

#### Strawberry 8\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Forsaken_City/Collectables?veaction=edit&section=13) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Forsaken_City/Collectables?action=edit&section=13)\]

[![](https://static.wikitide.net/celestewiki/thumb/6/60/Ch1a_8.png/800px-Ch1a_8.png)](https://celeste.ink/wiki/File:Ch1a_8.png)

At the start of Crossing, go on the higher platform, jump and dash diagonally in the upper right corner, collecting the refill and again dashing to the right, then instead of going up dash into the first block under the exit of the screen, which makes an exit appear in a small hidden path with the berry.

#### Strawberry 9\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Forsaken_City/Collectables?veaction=edit&section=14) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Forsaken_City/Collectables?action=edit&section=14)\]

[![](https://static.wikitide.net/celestewiki/thumb/7/73/Ch1a_9.png/800px-Ch1a_9.png)](https://celeste.ink/wiki/File:Ch1a_9.png)

In the third room of Crossing, the one with two zippers (one heading right straight into spikes, and the other heading upwards), use the first zipper normally, jump onto the second one, and boost up-leftwards to where an "up arrow" sign can be seen. From there, head left, and continue through another (relatively harder) room with two zippers. Once you're outside of the city, and can hear the "Piano Only" version of _First Steps_, jump and dash left until you find the satellite, collecting the strawberry on your way. Don't forget to collect the [Crystal Heart](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Forsaken_City/Collectibles#Crystal_Heart) while you're here!

#### Strawberry 10\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Forsaken_City/Collectables?veaction=edit&section=15) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Forsaken_City/Collectables?action=edit&section=15)\]

[![](https://static.wikitide.net/celestewiki/thumb/5/5a/Ch1a_10.png/800px-Ch1a_10.png)](https://celeste.ink/wiki/File:Ch1a_10.png)

In the fourth room of the sub-chapter, go up with the spring and dash into the block of ice, revealing a small room, dash diagonally in the upper left corner three times, grab the berry, walljump into the refill, diagonally dash in the upper right corner into the refill and do the same again.

#### Strawberry 11\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Forsaken_City/Collectables?veaction=edit&section=16) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Forsaken_City/Collectables?action=edit&section=16)\]

[![](https://static.wikitide.net/celestewiki/thumb/f/f6/Ch1a_11.png/800px-Ch1a_11.png)](https://celeste.ink/wiki/File:Ch1a_11.png)

Reach the room mentioned above in Strawberry 10, but instead of heading back after getting the berry, climb up on a floating block and then dash into an odd-looking tile on the ceiling, leading you to a secret room. After beating it you will enter another room, where you can find the berry and go back to the main trial.

#### Strawberry 12\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Forsaken_City/Collectables?veaction=edit&section=17) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Forsaken_City/Collectables?action=edit&section=17)\]

[![](https://static.wikitide.net/celestewiki/thumb/e/e1/Ch1a_12.png/800px-Ch1a_12.png)](https://celeste.ink/wiki/File:Ch1a_12.png)

In the seventh room after the checkpoint, you can find a small hole in the ground, which you can dash into instead of dashing onto the crumbling blocks; in the room you just entered jump on the 3 zipper blocks, grab the berry and wait a bit on the wall for the traffic light blocks to come back to their original position and come back to the entrance.

#### Strawberry 13\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Forsaken_City/Collectables?veaction=edit&section=18) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Forsaken_City/Collectables?action=edit&section=18)\]

[![](https://static.wikitide.net/celestewiki/thumb/5/51/Ch1a_13.png/800px-Ch1a_13.png)](https://celeste.ink/wiki/File:Ch1a_13.png)

The strawberry is located again in room 7, but this time, instead of going to the right to leave the room, go up and find another section with the berry, grab the zipper block and climb onto the wall. If you jump off the traffic light block, you will immediately get launched into spikes; jump on the other, smaller zipper, when it reaches its leftmost point, jump off of it, grab the wall and walljump off of it to get the berry.

#### Strawberry 14\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Forsaken_City/Collectables?veaction=edit&section=19) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Forsaken_City/Collectables?action=edit&section=19)\]

[![](https://static.wikitide.net/celestewiki/thumb/c/c6/Ch1a_14.png/800px-Ch1a_14.png)](https://celeste.ink/wiki/File:Ch1a_14.png)

In the eighth room, jump on the edge of the first zipper and use the boost from jumping off of it while it's going up to jump between the spikes surrounding the berry and if necessary dash up to grab it.

#### Strawberry 15\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Forsaken_City/Collectables?veaction=edit&section=20) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Forsaken_City/Collectables?action=edit&section=20)\]

[![](https://static.wikitide.net/celestewiki/thumb/9/9a/Ch1a_15.png/800px-Ch1a_15.png)](https://celeste.ink/wiki/File:Ch1a_15.png)

In the ninth and final room of Crossing, to reach the berry you can jump off a 2-tile wide platform, dash up to grab the zipper from the right side, when the zipper is on the right side jump off of it to quickly grab the berry, jump on the zipper and then jump up

### Chasm\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Forsaken_City/Collectables?veaction=edit&section=21) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Forsaken_City/Collectables?action=edit&section=21)\]

#### Strawberry 16\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Forsaken_City/Collectables?veaction=edit&section=22) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Forsaken_City/Collectables?action=edit&section=22)\]

[![](https://static.wikitide.net/celestewiki/thumb/5/5e/Fc_16_1.png/800px-Fc_16_1.png)](https://celeste.ink/wiki/File:Fc_16_1.png)

At the first room of Chasm, go left by grabbing the zipper and jump dash over it. Go into the room and go the down path by dashing over the zipper. Then, go on the spring in the next room and jump on it, then quickly jump down on the platform and go up. When outside, just jump down and dash back up after walljumping. Then just go back right by jumping down to the platform and dashing to the spring and dashing after the spike platform.

#### Strawberry 17\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Forsaken_City/Collectables?veaction=edit&section=23) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Forsaken_City/Collectables?action=edit&section=23)\]

[![](https://static.wikitide.net/celestewiki/thumb/1/12/Forsaken_City_berry_17.jpg/800px-Forsaken_City_berry_17.jpg)](https://celeste.ink/wiki/File:Forsaken_City_berry_17.jpg)

Follow the same path as for the previous berry but go up from the first room instead of left. Dash up into the traffic light block and launch yourself into the strawberry.

#### Strawberry 18\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Forsaken_City/Collectables?veaction=edit&section=24) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Forsaken_City/Collectables?action=edit&section=24)\]

[![](https://static.wikitide.net/celestewiki/thumb/c/c6/Forsaken_City_berry_18.jpg/800px-Forsaken_City_berry_18.jpg)](https://celeste.ink/wiki/File:Forsaken_City_berry_18.jpg)

Found in the first room, you need to fall off of the right bridge and move right to then dash straight up, allowing you to reach the strawberry.

#### Strawberry 19\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Forsaken_City/Collectables?veaction=edit&section=25) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Forsaken_City/Collectables?action=edit&section=25)\]

[![](https://static.wikitide.net/celestewiki/thumb/1/18/Forsaken_City_berry_19.jpg/800px-Forsaken_City_berry_19.jpg)](https://celeste.ink/wiki/File:Forsaken_City_berry_19.jpg)

Found to the right of the first room is another winged strawberry. Ride the traffic light block and jump off it once it reaches its furthest point to either land on the disappearing platform or grab the right wall. You can just go left after reaching the platform and bounce off the spring and into the reach of the winged strawberry.

#### Strawberry 20\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Forsaken_City/Collectables?veaction=edit&section=26) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Forsaken_City/Collectables?action=edit&section=26)\]

[![](https://static.wikitide.net/celestewiki/thumb/1/16/Forsaken_City_berry_20.jpg/800px-Forsaken_City_berry_20.jpg)](https://celeste.ink/wiki/File:Forsaken_City_berry_20.jpg)

In the fourth room, you can find a transition in the top-left by going through the wall behind a falling platform. In the room with the Strawberry, dash into the dash crystal above you and continue dashing into the other dash crystals all around the platform, grabbing the berry on the left and then continuing back right.

## Winged Golden Strawberry\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Forsaken_City/Collectables?veaction=edit&section=27) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Forsaken_City/Collectables?action=edit&section=27)\]

A [winged golden strawberry](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Forsaken_City/Winged_Gold_Berry) is present in Forsaken City's A-Side. Retrieving this strawberry requires not dashing during _the entire chapter_. A large variety of tech is required to beat this gauntlet; this includes large jumps (such as 6jumps), spike jumps, neutral jumps and many more.

# Chapter 1- Forsaken City

Chapter 1 lays the ground work for all the platforming glory to come in Celeste. It teaches you the basics of maneuvering and maintaining enough stamina, wile using the environment to the best of your ability. It also happens to be a dense level, packed with collectibles and secret rooms.

Play

Below is a list of all 20 strawberries for this level, as well as the locations for the cassette tape and the Crystal Heart.

## Start

### Strawberry \#1

The first strawberry is right out in the open on the second screen of the chapter. Use the spring to gain height and dash into the strawberry. Touch the ground to lock it in!

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/c/cf/180124_CI_C1_S1.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

### Strawberry \#2

On the screen immediately after the first strawberry is the second! Drop down from the platform above the fruit to grab it and dash into the wall to recover. Climb and wall jump back up to safety!

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/a/ac/180124_CI_C1_S2.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

### Strawberry \#3

This strawberry is the first flying strawberry you see. You cannot dash on this screen or you’ll scare it away. Use the platforms on the right to get above the flying fruit and drop down to collect it.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/0/09/180124_CI_C1_S3.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

### Strawberry \#4

The screen above the flying strawberry, go to the room on the left with the glowing light first. Jump and dash upward to make it to the landing in the middle. You can grab the wall if you need to climb up. Using the spring, hop over the spikes and fall gracefully downward, using your dash to collect the strawberry and land safely.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/7/7c/180124_CI_C1_S4.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

### Strawberry \#5

The screen above the flying strawberry, use the lift on the right to fling yourself up and to the left. Use your dash to grab the strawberry in the upper left corner.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/1/13/180124_CI_C1_S5.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

### Strawberry \#6

In the same room as Strawberry #5 is a breakable block in the lower right corner. Dash through it to find the sixth strawberry’s location. Drop through the spikes and dash to the geared platform. Ride it and jump off toward the strawberry. Catch a ride back and dash through the floor above to safely clear the room.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/4/48/180124_CI_C1_S6_A.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/e/e2/180124_CI_C1_S6_B.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

## Crossing

### Strawberry \#7

This strawberry is in a room above the character Theo. To find Theo, go left from the room with a green crystal in the center. Jump and dash diagonally to the left to hit the green crystal in this new room and dash again to make it to safe ground. Climb up the wall on the left to find a hidden area.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/8/87/180124_CI_C1_S7_A.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

Watch out for the spring on the ground beneath the spikes! Hop over the hazard and use the second spring to launch toward the wall. Grab it and jump over the spikes toward the green crystal. Dash toward safety and the strawberry. Drop down the passage on the left to see Theo.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/d/d2/180124_CI_C1_S7_B.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

### Strawberry \#8

Back in the room with the green crystal in the center (Reference photo above in Strawberry #7), make your way to the right. Climb up and dash above the crystal so you fall on it to regain your dash. Before hitting the spikes, dash to the right on safe ground. Instead of jumping up, dash through the brown rock to find a hidden strawberry.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/4/41/180124_CI_C1_S8.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

### Strawberry \#9

In the room with the two geared platforms (one that launches you to the right, the other upward), there is a secret passage that leads to the upper left corner. Using the upward geared platform, jump and dash into the small crevice next to the up arrow sign. This reveals the passage to the left corner.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/1/14/180124_CI_C1_S9_A.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

To clear this room, you need to overcome two geared platform obstacles. Wall jump to reach the top of the first, grab on to activate it and then quickly let go and dash over the spikes. Grab the second block and ride it all the way to the left. Climb in the small alcove above and let the platform pass beneath you. Climb onto the left side of the block and ride it back over. Wall jump your way out and go left.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/2/24/180124_CI_C1_S9_B.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

Dash through the air onto the only platforms until you reach the satellite where the strawberry is.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/a/ac/180124_CI_C1_S9_C.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

### Crystal Heart

Stick around at the satellite to find Chapter 1’s Crystal Heart. The birds are the key to this puzzle. After the computer beeps through a cycle, the birds strike a pose. Each color goes to the same spot. These locations are actually directions to dash in and the computer cycle is the order in which you need to dash.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/f/fe/180129_CI_C1_CH_A.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

The solution is Up, Left, Down-Right, Up-Right, Left, Up-Left. Dash in those directions and the Crystal Heart will appear.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/6/68/180129_CI_C1_CH_B.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

### Strawberry \#10

Continuing to go to the right, after the room with the secret passage in the center, hop on the spring and break the block in the upper left corner. Inside is a room with two green crystals, a spiked floor, Strawberry #10, AND the passage to the next collectible piece of fruit.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/e/eb/180124_CI_C1_S10.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

Use the crystals to make it to the far wall, wait for them to regenerate and then return safely to the right side of the screen with the fruit.

### Strawberry \#11

In the same room as Strawberry #10, climb the right-hand wall to reach the sole platform. Jump out into the middle and dash upward to find a new screen.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/5/53/180124_CI_C1_S11_A.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

Climb through this room, using the falling blocks and the geared platform to make it to the top. In the following room, you’ll spot the strawberry. Dash and climb your way to the brown platform. Drop down to the strawberry and dash in between the spikes to collect the green crystal. With your dash restored, dash diagonally upward to safety.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/f/fd/180124_CI_C1_S11_B.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

### Strawberry \#12

Advance a few couple more rooms until you reach the room with the floating column topped with spikes in the center.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/9/9a/180124_CI_C1_S12_A.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

Before leaving the room by going to the right, there are two other rooms that house strawberries. One of them is at the top and the other is at the bottom.

Using the column in the center, climb up to the platform in the left corner to regain your dash. Hop to the right side of the column and then leap to the disappearing block platform. Jump straight up to the small wooden ledge and climb into the room above.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/6/66/180124_CI_C1_S12_B.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

Use the geared platforms to go around the room and get the strawberry. Be careful to not jump off of the first platform too soon or the momentum will carry you into the spikes above. When on the horizontal-moving platform, use its momentum to leap down to the strawberry, dashing to clear the spikes on the ground.

### Strawberry \#13

Back in the center room, you can see a small path on the floor that drops into a room below. You need to drop down above the spikes and then dash into the small path.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/7/7d/180124_CI_C1_S13.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

In the room below, you simply need to hop across all three geared platforms to grab the strawberry at the end. Hold onto the wall until they reset and then hop your way back to safety.

### Strawberry \#14

This strawberry is out in the open, in between walls of spikes at the top of the screen. Use the momentum of the upward moving geared platforms in the room to launch close to the fruit and then dash upward to nab it. Be careful to not dash too high up or you’ll hit the spikes. Continue out of the room to lock in the strawberry.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/2/27/180124_CI_C1_S14.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

### Strawberry \#15

This strawberry requires you to be quick with your wall jumps. Out in the open as well, ride the geared platform on its left side. At the end, climb up to safety and recharge your stamina. Drop down and dash to the left to grab onto the geared platform, this time on its right-hand side. When it stops, jump off to grab the strawberry and then quickly wall jump back. Jump up to solid ground and lock in the fruit.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/0/00/180124_CI_C1_S15.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

## Chasm

### Strawberry \#16

To find the next couple of strawberries, you’ll need to get behind the geared platform in the open room. Grab onto it, ride it to a stop, then hop and dash over it to slip behind it into this new area.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/6/65/180124_CI_C1_S16_A.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

Skip over the geared platform in the floor and continue to the left. In the next room, use the blade of grass as a marker for how long your dash is. Dash to the spring on the floor and use its lift to safely dash to the wooden platform above. Drop down to the ledge with the green sign and then climb out of this room.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/5/56/180124_CI_C1_S16_B.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

Outside is the strawberry. Drop down to get it and then climb back up the wall to get to solid ground.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/6/63/180124_CI_C1_S16_C.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

### Cassette Tape

Back in the room with the geared platform in the floor, use its upward momentum to fling you to the ground above. Head into the next room to find a geared platform in the wall. Before using it to get the tantalizing strawberry on the right, activate it and sneak into the room behind it that is emitting a glow.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/a/af/180124_CI_C1_Cassette.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

This is a cassette tape room. The blue and pink platforms alternate based off the beat of the music. Time your jumps to navigate the room on the alternating platforms to grab the tape. This unlocks Chapter 1’s B Side level.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/c/cb/180124_CI_C1_Cassette_B.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

### Strawberry \#17

Back in the room with the geared platform in the floor, use its upward momentum to fling you to the ground above. Head into the next room to see your next strawberry. After getting the Cassette Tape, use the geared platform to fling yourself across the room to the strawberry.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/a/af/180124_CI_C1_Cassette.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

### Strawberry \#18

This strawberry is clear as day in the chasm room. Use the geared platform to launch yourself across the room. When beneath the strawberry’s location, dash up to snag it.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/4/4d/180124_CI_C1_S18.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

### Strawberry \#19

After snagging Strawberry #18, hop through the floor and go to the right. This room contains another flying strawberry. Use the geared platofrm to launch across the room to the disappearing blocks. Climb the right-hand wall up to the spring and grab the flying fruit.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/c/c2/180124_CI_C1_S19.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

### Strawberry \#20

In the spike room with the blocks that fall when you grab them will be the hiding spot for this strawberry.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/6/69/180124_CI_C1_S20_A.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

The block in the upper left corner will drop down if you grab it. Drop the block and then dash into the wall that was behind it to reveal a hidden path.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/5/53/180124_CI_C1_S20_B.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

The next screen reveals the strawberry. Use the green crystals to make your way up and around the spikes, grabbing the strawberry along the way.

![](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/celeste/d/d9/180124_CI_C1_S20_C.png?width=200&quality=20&dpr=0.05)

**Chapter 1: Forsaken City** is the first proper chapter of [Celeste](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Celeste) (although it is technically preceded by the [Prologue](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Prologue)). The chapter introduces many of the primary game mechanics and collectables, including acquainting the player with the dash maneuver and introducing both normal and winged strawberries. It also introduces several [objects](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Objects) to the game, detailed [below](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Chapter_1#Objects). Additionally, this chapter introduces one character: [Theo](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Theo).

### **Winged Golden Strawberry**\[\]

Forsaken City is the only A-Side that features a hidden secret that can only be found if the player decides to finish the entire chapter without dashing even once. In order to complete this challenge, players need to abuse the game's lenient hitboxes and "coyote frames" in order to perform very tight and difficult jumps. The player also has to learn a technique called "neutral jumping", which will be needed in a few sections towards the end. If the player manages to complete the chapter without dashing even once, a flying Golden Strawberry will appear on the last screen.

Unlike all other Golden Strawberries, the player doesn't have to complete this chapter without dying in order to get it.

## **Plot**\[\]

**I tried to warn you.**

This section contains spoilers for Chapter 1: Forsaken City. Do not read the following section if you wish to avoid spoilers for Chapter 1: Forsaken City.

[Madeline](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Madeline) travels through the titular Forsaken City, finding another hiker, Theo, about halfway through the level. Madeline and Theo converse, and Theo explains that he came to Celeste Mountain to explore and to take pictures, although Madeline avoids explaining why she came to Celeste Mountain. The two also discuss the origins of the Forsaken City, with Madeline explaining that a mega-corporation started building the city, but nobody wanted to live there, although neither of them know why. Madeline also expresses a desire to reach the summit of Celeste Mountain, something that Theo does not seem as interested in doing. Eventually, Madeline returns to climbing Celeste Mountain. At the end of the level, she encounters a memorial (entitled the Celeste Memorial), decides to stop there and make camp for the night, and goes to sleep, thinking that climbing Celeste Mountain might have been a mistake.

# Start (Forsaken City)

[Sign in to edit](https://auth.fandom.com/signin?redirect=https%3A%2F%2Fcelestegame.fandom.com%2Fwiki%2FStart_%28Forsaken_City%29%3Fveaction%3Dedit&uselang=en)

**Start** is the first subchapter of [Chapter 1: Forsaken City](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Chapter_1:_Forsaken_City) in [Celeste](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Celeste). The subchapter introduces basic [mechanics](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Objects), including spikes, springs, disappearing platforms, and smashable walls. Red [Strawberries](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Collectibles) also first appear here in both normal and winged form. Traffic light blocks, Forsaken City's signature mechanic, are introduced in this subchapter too. There are no story moments found in this subchapter.

## Contents

- [1**Gameplay**](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Start_(Forsaken_City)#Gameplay)
 - [1.1Winged Golden Strawberry](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Start_(Forsaken_City)#Winged_Golden_Strawberry)
 - [1.2**Strawberries**](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Start_(Forsaken_City)#Strawberries)
- [2**Gallery**](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Start_(Forsaken_City)#Gallery)

## **Gameplay**\[\]

There are only 6 screens mandatory to get through in this subchapter, all of which are fairly simple. By dashing diagonally upward, the player can easily make it through these screens. Make sure not to launch Madeline into the spikes in the fourth room by simply not moving while on the traffic light block.

### Winged Golden Strawberry\[\]

While attempting to do this chapter without dashing to get the Winged Golden Strawberry, the rooms become more challenging. Aside from the second room, the solution is self-explanatory and won't end up very difficult without dashing. In the second room, the jump normally appears impossible as jumping from the height of your climb doesn't make it to the other side of the gap. The trick to doing this room is using the 'spike jump', a tech which allows you to jump from higher than usual. To do this you must reach the top of your climb's height and jump up, then you can jump off the wall as you descend higher than you could from simply jumping while climbing. This barely allows you to bypass the spikes.

### **Strawberries**\[\]

There are 6 Strawberries found in this subchapter (not including the Golden Strawberry which spawns in the first room).

Berry 1

Found in the second room of the subchapter, this is likely the simplest Strawberry you'll get. Bounce off the spring in this room and you can move slightly left and dash directly upward to collect it.

Berry 2

Found in the third room of the subchapter, you can find this Strawberry at the end of the room hovering above some spikes. Run off the platform near it and dash directly upward as soon as you touch the berry, then move to the right and climb up the wall for the safest grab.

Berry 3

Found in the fifth room of the subchapter, this is the first Winged Strawberry of the game. Instead of rushing through this room, you can get to the top without needing to dash with simple jumps and climbing the wall from the right, then walking off the platform.

Berry 4

Found in a hidden room to the left of the sixth room of the subchapter, this is a more complicated Strawberry to collect than the last few. You can either wall jump on the metallic wall or dash directly upward after climbing briefly and jumping. From here, walk on the spring and continue left, then keep yourself inbetween the walls and dash to the right before falling in the spikes to collect the berry.

Berry 5

Found in the sixth room of the subchapter, you must use the momentum from being launched up by the traffic light block and move yourself to the left to grab the floating platform. From there, climb a bit and dash in the direction of the Strawberry.

Berry 6

Found in a hidden room to the right of the sixth room of the subchapter accessed by dashing into the block of ice, this Strawberry can be slightly tricky. You have to fall between the 2 spiked walls and then from there either grab the left wall and jump from there into a diagonal upward dash or dash without needing to touch the wall to land on the traffic light block. After landing, it will take you right to the berry where you can collect it and make it back by simply dashing diagonally through the bridge.

**Cassette Tapes** are special entities in the A-Sides of chapters 1 through 8. They unlock each chapter's respective [B-Side](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Alternate_sides#B-Sides). As such, collecting them is required to unlock a chapter's red crystal heart, and all of them must be collected before the C-Sides are unlocked. Cassette Tapes are always in a Cassette Room, featuring [Cassette Blocks](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Cassette_Block) and an 8-bit remix of the chapter's music. Collecting a Cassette Tape will always lead to Madeline being transported, via bubble, back to the beginning of the room she came from (in [8A](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Core#A-Side) she gets bubbled to the end instead).

At the level select screen, you can see the checkpoint where the cassette tape (along with strawberries) is found, which can help you locate it.

## Locations of Cassette Tapes

\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Cassette_Tape?veaction=edit&section=1) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Cassette_Tape?action=edit&section=1)\]

**Thou hast been warned!**

This section contains spoilers for Celeste. Do not read the following section if you wish to avoid spoilers for Celeste.

### [Forsaken City](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Forsaken_City)

\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Cassette_Tape?veaction=edit&section=2) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Cassette_Tape?action=edit&section=2)\]

The cassette is hidden at the beginning of the Chasm checkpoint. To find it, go past the zipper on the left to reach an optional area, and then stand on the next zipper and launch yourself upwards. It will take you to a berry room. In the wall to the left is the hole, covered by another zip mover. Grab it to get it out of the way, and the cassette room can be found past the gap in the wall.

### [Old Site](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Old_Site)

\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Cassette_Tape?veaction=edit&section=3) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Cassette_Tape?action=edit&section=3)\]

It's found in the Start checkpoint. Go down-right to activate the dream blocks, and after coming back to the "hub" section, fall to the very bottom and dash through the dream block in the ground.

### [Celestial Resort](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Celestial_Resort)

\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Cassette_Tape?veaction=edit&section=4) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Cassette_Tape?action=edit&section=4)\]

The cassette can be found in Elevator Shaft. Get to the key room and the entrance will be visible on the very far left. It's indicated by a light beam coming out of the hole.

### [Golden Ridge](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Golden_Ridge)

\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Cassette_Tape?veaction=edit&section=5) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Cassette_Tape?action=edit&section=5)\]

The cassette is fairly early in the Start checkpoint. After passing through the touch switch room, the next room has a hidden entrance that can be seen in the top-left corner. Use the second white cloud to reach this height, and run to the left of the berry room which takes you to another hidden area with the tape.

### [Mirror Temple](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Mirror_Temple)

\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Cassette_Tape?veaction=edit&section=6) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Cassette_Tape?action=edit&section=6)\]

This cassette is found in the Depths checkpoint and can be easily missed if you aren't exploring the entire map. After going past two rooms to the right of where you first encounter [Theo](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Theo) in the mirror, fall off the metal platform and take a red booster to the right. Then, pass the next room and the one after it to get to a room with [strawberry seeds](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Strawberry_seeds). Finally, go through a cracked wall on the right to enter the cassette room.

### [Reflection](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Reflection)

\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Cassette_Tape?veaction=edit&section=7) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Cassette_Tape?action=edit&section=7)\]

It's found in the Hollows checkpoint, behind a breakable wall on the bottom-left side. Take a Kevin block to the bottom and let it break the wall, opening the way to the cassette tape room.

### [The Summit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/The_Summit)

\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Cassette_Tape?veaction=edit&section=8) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Cassette_Tape?action=edit&section=8)\]

It can be found in the 5th room of 1500m by going through an optional path at the top. It's easily noticeable, but you must dodge a moving dust bunny that blocks the pathway.

### [Core](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Core)

\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Cassette_Tape?veaction=edit&section=9) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Cassette_Tape?action=edit&section=9)\]

The Cassette Tape room is right at the end, and you _must_ collect it to get to the Crystal Heart and complete the chapter.

## Trivia

\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Cassette_Tape?veaction=edit&section=10) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Cassette_Tape?action=edit&section=10)\]

- The original method of obtaining the Cassette Tapes was going to be by collecting several music notes. The player would have to grab multiple of them without touching the ground, similar to how [Strawberry Seeds](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Collectables#Strawberry_Seeds) work in the final game.[\[1\]](https://celeste.ink/celeste.ink#cite_note-1)
- In [Celeste 64](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Celeste_64), the cassette tapes don't unlock B-Sides, but upon touching them, the player is transported to a room with a strawberry and Cassette Blocks.

Cassette Tape in-game sprite

**B-Side Cassette Tapes** (or simply **Cassettes** for short) are collectible items, one of which can be found in each of the story chapters. Obtaining a chapter's Cassette is required in order to unlock the chapter's B-side level, which uses the mechanics of its respective chapter but is significantly harder. Cassettes are always obtainable in their own room after a gauntlet of [Rhythm Blocks](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Rhythm_Blocks). The following page details how to obtain these Cassettes.

## Contents

- [1Chapter 1: Forsaken City](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Cassette_Guide#Chapter_1:_Forsaken_City)
- [2Chapter 2: Old Site](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Cassette_Guide#Chapter_2:_Old_Site)
- [3Chapter 3: Celestial Resort](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Cassette_Guide#Chapter_3:_Celestial_Resort)
- [4Chapter 4: Golden Ridge](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Cassette_Guide#Chapter_4:_Golden_Ridge)
- [5Chapter 5: Mirror Temple](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Cassette_Guide#Chapter_5:_Mirror_Temple)
- [6Chapter 6: Reflection](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Cassette_Guide#Chapter_6:_Reflection)
- [7Chapter 7: The Summit](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Cassette_Guide#Chapter_7:_The_Summit)
- [8Chapter 8: Core](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Cassette_Guide#Chapter_8:_Core)

## Chapter 1: Forsaken City\[\]

This chapter's Cassette room can be found in this chapter's third sub-chapter, "Chasm". If the player goes behind the [Traffic Light Block](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Traffic_Light_Blocks) in the sub-chapter's first room, then goes two rooms up, and then goes behind the next Conveyor-belt Platform, the Cassette room will become accessible.

## Chapter 2: Old Site\[\]

This Cassette can be found in this chapter's first sub-chapter, "Start", but only after the mirror encounter with [Badeline](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Badeline). The player must go down as soon as they enter the large room (the first one where the player has any agency over movement), and must then dash down through the [Dream Block](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Dream_Blocks) in the floor of said room, exposing the Cassette room.

## Chapter 3: Celestial Resort\[\]

This Cassette can be found in this chapter's third sub-chapter, "Elevator Shaft", just to the left of the chapter's singular [Key](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Keys) (indicated by the opening through a broken wall with light shining out of it).

## Chapter 4: Golden Ridge\[\]

This chapter's Cassette can be found in this chapter's first sub-chapter, "Start". Just after finishing the room that requires the player to collect two [Shields](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Shields) in order to move a [Shield-Activated Platform](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Shield-Activated_Platforms), the player must bounce on the second [White Cloud](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/White_Clouds) from the left, then dash up and left in order to access the top-left corner of the room. The player must then go as far left as possible, passing through the following room (which should contain a number of [Springs](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Springs) and strawberry fragments in order to find this Cassette's room.

## Chapter 5: Mirror Temple\[\]

This Cassette can be found in this chapter's second sub-chapter, "Depths". After passing the third [Temple Gate](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Temple_Gates)—the one just after a challenge involving a single [Swap Block](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Swap_Blocks)—the player should head down and to the right in order to find a hidden room leading to a [Red Orb](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Red_Orbs). Taking this orb to the right will lead to a platforming segment; completing this segment and pressing the [Dash Switch](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Dash_Switches) there will open another Temple Gate to the bottom right of this room. Clearing this second room by depressing its Dash Switch will open yet another Temple Gate at the bottom right of this following room, leading to a third, more illuminated room. At the bottom right of this third room, the player can simply walk through a section of cracked wall (with or without completing any associated challenges) to access the Cassette room.

## Chapter 6: Reflection\[\]

This Cassette can be found in the first room of this chapter's third sub-chapter, "Hollows". To access the Cassette room, the player must use the nearby [Kevin Block](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Kevin_Blocks) to break the wall below it and send the Block to the bottom of the lake. The player must then quickly attack the Kevin Block again to make it break the wall to its left, exposing the entryway into the Cassette room.

## Chapter 7: The Summit\[\]

This chapter's Cassette can be found in its fourth sub-chapter, "1500M". Upon entering this sub-chapter's fifth room, an opening can be seen leading out the top of the room. Entering this opening will lead to the cassette room.

## Chapter 8: Core\[\]

This cassette lies at the end of the chapter and is required to complete it.

# Alternate sides

From Celeste Wiki

[Jump to navigation](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Alternate_sides#mw-head) [Jump to search](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Alternate_sides#searchInput)

**Alternate sides** (namely **B-Sides** and **C-Sides**) are essentially harder but shorter versions of a chapter. They exist in every chapter except [Prologue](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Prologue), [Epilogue](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Epilogue) and [Farewell](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Farewell).

In alternate sides, a remix of the chapter's music is used. These remixes are known as [Celeste B-Sides](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Celeste_B-Sides), although the exact same soundtrack plays in C-Sides as well.

Alternate sides do not have any [Red Strawberries](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Collectables#Red_Strawberries), but [Golden Strawberries](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Golden_Strawberries) can be found and collected there if they have been unlocked and the alternate side has been completed before.

Additionally, alternate sides of all levels will be instantly unlocked when [Cheat Mode](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Cheat_Mode) is enabled in the save file.

## Contents

- [1B-Sides](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Alternate_sides#B-Sides)
- [2C-Sides](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Alternate_sides#C-Sides)
- [3Trivia](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Alternate_sides#Trivia)
- [4References](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Alternate_sides#References)

## B-Sides\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Alternate_sides?veaction=edit&section=1) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Alternate_sides?action=edit&section=1)\]

[![](https://static.wikitide.net/celestewiki/4/4a/Red_crystal_heart_asset.png)](https://celeste.ink/wiki/File:Red_crystal_heart_asset.png) A Red Crystal Heart

A B-Side for a given chapter can be unlocked by collecting a [Cassette Tape](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Cassette_Tape) in the A-Side of the level. It can then be accessed right away, even if the A-Side is not completed yet, and it is possible to unlock the new chapter by completing the B-Side instead. This is commonly used in speedruns to save time, since 5B and 6B are shorter than their A-Side counterparts.

Like A-Sides, B-Sides are segmented into checkpoints.

At the end of each B-Side is a Cassette Block Room, the only room in the B-Side having [Cassette Blocks](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Cassette_Blocks), and which ends with a Red [Crystal Heart](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Crystal_Heart). Collecting the Red Crystal Heart by dashing into it ends the B-Side.

Completing all B-Sides except [Core B-Side](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Core#B-Side) is required to unlock the [Crystal Heart Gate](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Crystal_Heart_Gate) in [Farewell](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Farewell) and 8B.

[4B](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Golden_Ridge#B-Side)  •  [5B](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Mirror_Temple#B-Side)  •  [6B](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Reflection#B-Side)

[7B](https://celeste.ink/wiki/The_Summit#B-Side)  •  [8B](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Core#B-Side)

## C-Sides\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Alternate_sides?veaction=edit&section=2) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Alternate_sides?action=edit&section=2)\]

[![](https://static.wikitide.net/celestewiki/5/54/Yellow_crystal_heart_asset.png)](https://celeste.ink/wiki/File:Yellow_crystal_heart_asset.png) A Yellow Crystal Heart

C-Sides are unlocked after completing 8B, which, in turn, requires completion of all B-Sides. They are significantly shorter than A-Sides and B-Sides, consisting of 3–4 rooms with no checkpoints. However, the rooms are longer and more difficult, with the final room being significantly longer than most usual rooms.

C-Sides end with a Yellow Crystal Heart. Like its B-Side, completing all other C-sides is required to unlock the Crystal Heart Gate in [Core C-Side](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Core#C-Side), which on completion unlocks [Variant Mode](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Variant_Mode) and [Golden Strawberries](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Golden_Strawberries).

[1C](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Forsaken_City#C-Side)  •  [2C](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Old_Site#C-Side)  •  [3C](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Celestial_Resort#C-Side)

[4C](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Golden_Ridge#C-Side)  •  [5C](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Mirror_Temple#C-Side)  •  [6C](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Reflection#C-Side)

[7C](https://celeste.ink/wiki/The_Summit#C-Side)  •  [8C](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Core#C-Side)

## Trivia\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Alternate_sides?veaction=edit&section=3) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Alternate_sides?action=edit&section=3)\]

- B-Sides were initially called "Hard Mode" during development and later named "Remix Mode" before ultimately being named "B-Sides" [\[1\]](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Alternate_sides#cite_note-1)
- Progressing through completing B-Sides before A-Sides was unintended.[\[2\]](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Alternate_sides#cite_note-2)

Blue **Crystal Hearts** are collectibles throughout the game and are one of the three types of hearts which are used to unlock various gates throughout the game such as [Chapter 8](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Chapter_8) and its alternate sides as well as [Chapter 9](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Chapter_9) past the heart gate in [Event Horizon](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Event_Horizon) (see [this page](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Collectibles#Crystal_Hearts) for more information on the different types of hearts). The following page details how to obtain the blue Crystal Hearts in the game.

## Chapter 1\[\]

[![Pointless Machine Achievement](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/celestegame/images/5/55/Pointless_Machine_Achievement.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20180820205431)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/celestegame/images/5/55/Pointless_Machine_Achievement.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20180820205431)

Pointless machines

The Crystal Heart in this chapter can be found in [Chapter 1](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Chapter_1)'s second sub-chapter, [Crossing](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Crossing). After passing the house, the player must get on the first [Conveyor-Belt Platform](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Conveyor-Belt_Platforms) in the following room and advance to the second as usual; however, on the second Conveyor-Belt Platform, the player must jump left as they're flung into the air and dash upwards to the left of the up sign, revealing a secret passage. The player must then dash to the left from there to get to the room connecting to this screen's top-left corner. After a few screens, the player will arrive at the location of a computer. Here the Crystal Heart puzzle begins.

The computer will flash a sequence of colors; nearby, there will be a number of small, colored birds, each of whom corresponds with a color that the computer flashes. The computer will flash a series of colors intermittently, followed by the birds all moving in different directions. To obtain the heart, one must pay attention to the sequence of colors that the computer flashes, as well as the directions that the birds move in every time the sequence finishes. The player must dash in the direction that each bird corresponds to in the order in the computer's light sequence where that bird's color appears on the computer (in relation to the other colors, not in real time). The direction sequence that the player must perform is:

[![Celeste Birds](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/celestegame/images/e/e7/Celeste_Birds.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/220?cb=20201006071705)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/celestegame/images/e/e7/Celeste_Birds.png/revision/latest?cb=20201006071705)

Color Directions

- Up (White)
- Left (Purple)
- Down-Right (Blue)
- Up-Right (Red)
- Left (Purple)
- Up-Left (Yellow)

Performing this series of dashes will cause the birds to form into this chapter's Crystal Heart (entitled _Pointless machines_) which the player can then obtain.

## Chapter 2\[\]

[![Resurrections](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/celestegame/images/5/5e/Resurrections.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20190213173921)

Resurrections

The Crystal Heart in this chapter is located in [Chapter 2](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Chapter_2)'s first sub-chapter, [Start](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Start_(Old_Site)). In theory, this Crystal Heart should be quite easy to locate, being two screens up from the starting screen of the chapter. In practice, it is very difficult to locate, as there are no [objects](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Objects) that will help one to get there. One of the ways to get there is by exploiting a piece of the game's physics that recharges the player's dash when the player moves from one screen to another. This mechanic is not directly taught in the game (although it is indirectly taught when the player attempts to collect an early strawberry in [Chapter 3](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Chapter_3:_Celestial_Resort)), and for this reason, it is regarded by many as one of the hardest Crystal Hearts to find without a guide. The mechanic allows the player to essentially climb thin air by dashing off of the right side of the first screen onto the second screen, then back, repeating until the player moves up to the screen above the first screen. After climbing up a wall from this third screen onto a fourth screen, the player can then fall down onto the third screen, dash onto the fourth screen, and repeat until one finds a wall. The player can then climb this wall, after which the player can easily reach the topmost screen, where one can simply walk over to this chapter's Crystal Heart (entitled _Resurrections_) and obtain it.

Another way to get to this crystal heart is to first get onto the second screen, climb up the wall, stand on the left edge of the platform above the second screen, jump to the far left of the platform and then dash left as soon as the player leaves the screen. By doing so, the player lands on the platform on the left and can then continue climbing up towards the crystal heart.

The heart can also be seen (but not obtained) in the [Awake](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Awake) subchapter of Chapter 2, where it is easier to locate, and a poem lies near it with hints of how to obtain it:

_An apparition_

_Not of this world_

_But because of it_

_Lurking_ _**out of frame**_

_Awake, my heart is a fortress_

_**In dreams I am vulnerable**_

## Chapter 3\[\]

[![Scattered and lost](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/celestegame/images/7/7f/Scattered_and_lost.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20190213174144)

Scattered and lost

The Crystal Heart in [Chapter 3](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Chapter_3) is located in the second sub-chapter, [Huge Mess](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Huge_Mess). After being tasked to help clean up by Mr. Oshiro, the player must advance to the lower path of the two in the upper right corner. Once the player reaches and activates the large button to clear the purple and white towels, one must advance not to the left as usual, but to the right. The player must then travel up into the crevice that a stream of water is falling out of to reveal a secret path, leading back to one of the earlier rooms of the path. One must then advance upwards and then to the left (in reverse of the way the player first goes through the area) until the player reaches the first room, where the player first runs into Theo in Chapter 3. There is a path at the top of the screen that was previously blocked by towels; the player must dash up to this path and follow it upward to find this chapter's Crystal Heart (entitled _Scattered and lost_) and obtain it.

## Chapter 4\[\]

[![Eye of the storm](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/celestegame/images/e/e4/Eye_of_the_storm.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20190213174319)

Eye of the storm

[Chapter 4](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Chapter_4)'s Crystal Heart is located at the very beginning of the second sub-chapter, [Shrine](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Shrine). To reach the Crystal Heart, the player must cling to the [Guided Platform](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Guided_Platforms), then navigate it left to avoid hitting the wall, after which the player should move it back to the right. Once the player lands, the player must go to the right, into the lit up area. Once one goes into the next room, the player should see a waterfall pouring into a pool of [water](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Water). The player must then swim towards the bottom right corner, and keep swimming to the right until the player reaches a hidden area with a strawberry. The player must then dash into the [Smashable Wall](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Smashable_Walls) to the right to break it, after which the player should reach a tall room. One cannot reach the top normally; the player must crouch on top of the room's idiosyncratic white block until the player disappears. The player is now in the background instead of the foreground, thus allowing one to interact with objects in the background (a trick borrowed from [Super Mario Bros. 3](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Super_Mario_Bros._3), which has a similar block with a similar gimmick). This object interaction allows the player to climb to the top of the screen, where the Crystal Heart (entitled _Eye of the storm_) is located.

## Chapter 5\[\]

[![Quiet and falling](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/celestegame/images/e/e2/Quiet_and_falling.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20190213175216)

Quiet and falling

[Chapter 5](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Chapter_5)'s Crystal Heart is located in the second sub-chapter, [Depths](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Depths). After getting the key above the statue, the player must enter the room beneath the statue to the right, then hop on the nearby bubble and travel to the right. Instead of opening the door at the end of the room, the player must enter a second bubble and travel to the left, then dash up into the center of the second platform on their way back. This moves the player into a third bubble that they can use to travel upwards, leading to a secret path above the door. After making their way through the long hallway to reach the next room and going through that room as normal, the player must now head to the bottom of the following room and dash downwards to break the brown [Smashable Wall](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Smashable_Walls) in the floor. This reveals another locked door that they can use the key on, which leads to the Crystal Heart's room. In order to navigate in the room, one must go along the outer edges of the room, using a set of moving blocks and platforms to get to the Crystal Heart (entitled _Quiet and falling_) and obtain it.

## Chapter 6\[\]

[![Heavy and frail](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/celestegame/images/4/4d/Heavy_and_frail.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20190213175253)

Heavy and frail

[Chapter 6](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Chapter_6:_Reflection)'s Crystal Heart is located at the beginning of the third sub-chapter, [Hollows](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Hollows). At the start of the sub-chapter, the player must use the [Angry Platform](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Angry_Platforms) to break through the wall below to get to the first [Feather](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Feathers). One must then use it to fly up-right, and then dash down to break the [Smashable Wall](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Smashable_Walls), revealing the second Feather. The player must use that Feather to fly upwards, then climb to the third Feather, and finally use that Feather to fly to the left of the screen, revealing an entrance to a secret room. After going through the room and breaking another Smashable Wall, the player will see a puzzle with a statue, 6 colored crystals, 4 torches and 3 symbols.

[![Celeste Birds](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/celestegame/images/e/e7/Celeste_Birds.png/revision/latest?cb=20201006071705)

Bird Color Directions (see Chapter 1)

In order to solve the puzzle, one must repeat the pattern required to obtain the first chapter's Crystal Heart; doing so correctly will light up the first torch. The same thing must be done for the rest, but with slight alterations for each following torch: the second torch's pattern must be the first, but mirrored left-right (e.g an up-left on the first torch must be an up-right dash for the second); the third torch's pattern has to be mirrored up-down (e.g. an upwards dash on the first must be a downwards dash for the third), and the fourth one's pattern must be mirrored both up-down and left-right (e.g. an up-left dash on the first must be a down-right dash for the fourth). For a complete list of directions, see below:

- First torch: Up, Left, Down-Right, Up-Right, Left, Up-Left
- Second torch: Up, Right, Down-Left, Up-Left, Right, Up-Right
- Third torch: Down, Left, Up-Right, Down-Right, Left, Down-Left
- Fourth torch: Down, Right, Up-Left, Down-Left, Right, Down-Right

After lighting up all 4 torches, the Crystal Heart (entitled _Heavy and frail_) will be granted on top of the statue.

## Chapter 7\[\]

[![Pink sunrise](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/celestegame/images/c/c3/Pink_sunrise.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20190213175701)

Pink sunrise

To obtain the crystal heart in [Chapter 7](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Chapter_7), you must find six Jewels hidden in each subchapter— a blue star for Reflection at the [Start](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Start_(The_Summit)), a sapphire square for Forsaken City at [500 M](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/500_M), an emerald oval for Old Site at [1000 M](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/1000_M), a gold circle for Celestial Resort at [1500 M](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/1500_M), a pink diamond for Golden Ridge at [2000 M](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/2000_M), and a white pearl for Mirror Temple at [2500 M](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/2500_M). You obtain the crystal heart in [3000 M](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/3000_M) after getting all the Jewels.

#### Star\[\]

The first Jewel is located at the end of the last screen of the Start subchapter. After bouncing off of the last [Spring](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Springs), the player must use both dashes to jump over the final [Purple Orb](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Purple_Orbs), then climb up the wall on the right. The screen should move, revealing the first Jewel.

#### Sapphire\[\]

The route to 500 M's Jewel starts in the sub-chapter's 3rd screen, where, after going up on the first [Traffic Light Block](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Traffic_Light_Blocks), the player must go left instead of going right at the intersection. The player should then go right after climbing to the top of the tall screen that follows. In the following room, just to the right of the second Traffic Light Block, there is a tiny gap in the ground, which the player must fall through to find the room with the second Jewel. Completing the spike-lined obstacle course will allow the player to obtain this Jewel.

#### Emerald\[\]

For 1000 M's Jewel, the player must go through the upper left or upper right route of the 5th screen of the subchapter. If you choose the upper left route, you have to go up through the first [Space Block](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Space_Blocks), then use the Space Block on the right to break a [Smashable Wall](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Smashable_Walls). You will then enter into a room with a strawberry. Going up through the spiked platform will lead you to the path to the Jewel. Going the upper right route will skip the berry. The player must dash to the right in the middle of two Space Blocks to break a Smashable Wall; breaking this wall will reveal another room with [Skull Binoculars](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Skull_Binoculars), as well as with a concealed [Disappearing Platform](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Disappearing_Platforms) which the player must stand on to fall to the chamber below. Completing this chamber will allow the player to obtain this Jewel.

#### Gold\[\]

1500 M's Jewel is at the end of the 7th screen of the subchapter and is probably the easiest one to find. Below the exit upwards into the 8th screen, a broken wall can be seen. Going through there and completing the room that it reveals will allow the player to obtain this Jewel.

#### Diamond\[\]

2000 M's Jewel is a trek to get to. To the left of the second room is a seemingly pointless room. In one of the gaps above the player (the widest one above the pit of [Crystal Spikes](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Crystal_Spikes)), there is a secret platform to stand on, which the player can use to jump all the way to the left of the screen. In the next screen, there is a broken area of the roof, providing another entrance to a secret platform. The player must get there, jump off to the left, dash up to the left, and then dash up as soon as the player is past the wall that they need to climb up. Going up through the hole will reveal the Jewel.

#### Pearl\[\]

To reach 2500 M's Jewel, the player must take the first Red Bubble left, causing it to break the wall at the left of the first screen. The player must then enter the Red Bubble in the newly revealed screen and take that to the right, causing it to break several more walls before it eventually stops moving. The player must then go up and complete the following screen to obtain this Jewel.

#### Crystal Heart\[\]

At checkpoint 28 at 3000 M, the player must dash under the gap in the wall to the player's right, causing the camera to move and reveal the room with the Crystal Heart. If the player has all of the Jewels, they will pop out of the floor, and the Crystal Heart (entitled _Pink sunrise_) will move to a place where the player can obtain it.

## Chapter 8\[\]

The Crystal Heart in [Chapter 8](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Chapter_8) is the most straightforward to obtain, as it is required to obtain at the end of the fourth subchapter, [Heart of the Mountain](https://celestegame.fandom.com/wiki/Heart_of_the_Mountain), to complete the chapter. After getting past all of the chapter's obstacles, the player can complete the level and simultaneously be awarded the Crystal Heart (entitled _Heart of the mountain_).

**Crystal Hearts** are high-importance collectables in _Celeste_. Their primary purpose is to unlock different chapters locked by [Heart Doors](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Heart_Door); thus, they are also a prerequisite to unlocking all [C-Sides](https://celeste.ink/wiki/C-Sides), [Variant Mode](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Variant_Mode), and [Golden Strawberries](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Golden_Strawberries). They also serve as chapter completion objectives for all B-Sides, all C-Sides, and [Core A-Side](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Core#A-Side). Blue Crystal Hearts appear in every A-Side, Red Crystal Hearts in every B-Side, Gold Crystal Hearts in every C-Side, and a Gray Crystal Heart in [Farewell](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Farewell), which is revealed to be fake and has cracks. Each Crystal Heart, except the C-Side ones, also has a name specific to itself and an associated [achievement](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Achievements) with said name.

A Crystal Heart can be collected by dashing into it. In [5B](https://celeste.ink/wiki/5B), a crystal heart can also be gathered by throwing a [Theo Crystal](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Theo_Crystal) into it.

After a heart is collected, Madeline slows down, and the game continues to run for 135 frames (~2.25 seconds) before she completely stops. It is possible to die during these 135 frames if, for instance, Madeline dashes into spikes. After the collection cutscene depicting the heart in the middle of the screen, the heart is saved and will remain in the save file indefinitely.

## A-Side Crystal Hearts\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Crystal_Heart?veaction=edit&section=1) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Crystal_Heart?action=edit&section=1)\]

Crystal Hearts in A-Sides serve as well-guarded secrets, often hiding at quite a significant distance from the main path or requiring otherwise tedious tasks to be performed. These Crystal Hearts are blue, and each one has a unique name and achievement associated with it.

An exception to this rule is [Core A-Side](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Core#A-Side): there, it acts the same way as a B-Side or a C-Side heart, being located at the end of the level, and collecting it ends the level. Such hearts also exist within various Celeste [custom maps](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Maps).

[A guide](https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2027298456) is available for anyone struggling with locating the Crystal Hearts. It contains a lot of hints and pointers before giving out the solution, so try it out!

## B-Side and C-Side Crystal Hearts\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Crystal_Heart?veaction=edit&section=2) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Crystal_Heart?action=edit&section=2)\]

Crystal Hearts appear at the end of a [Cassette Block](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Cassette_Block) room in every [B-Side](https://celeste.ink/wiki/B-Side) in _Celeste_. These Crystal Hearts are red, and each of them also has a unique name and achievement associated with it.

Every [C-Side](https://celeste.ink/wiki/C-Side) also contains a Crystal Heart at its end. Unlike the B-Side crystal hearts, these often aren't located at safe locations, and Madeline can die while collecting them. These Crystal Hearts are gold in color, and unlike A and B-Side Crystal hearts, they do not have an associated name or achievement. They also do not appear in the [journal](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Journal).

All B-Side and C-Side Crystal Hearts double as [golden strawberry](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Golden_strawberry) collection triggers. The "1000" that appears when a strawberry is collected appears when the heart cutscene plays and remains on screen until the "spinning heart" animation is skipped.

## Trivia\[ [edit](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Crystal_Heart?veaction=edit&section=3) \| [edit source](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Crystal_Heart?action=edit&section=3)\]

- In early development, only one large heart was meant to exist in the game, and the collectables in each chapter would have been heart shards that would potentially unlock Core. It was changed to what it is now in the release version.[\[1\]](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Crystal_Heart#cite_note-1)
- Every heart color plays a slightly different pitch of the collection sound.
- Golden strawberries are saved immediately after dashing into a Crystal Heart in chapters that end with them. Dying after collecting a heart will save the golden strawberry and will respawn the player at the nearest checkpoint instead of at the beginning of the level.
- The heart names were initially meant to be an experiment with a poem that could have possibly been reassembled in the [journal](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Journal), but the idea was never fulfilled, and realigning the hearts is purely cosmetic.[\[2\]](https://celeste.ink/wiki/Crystal_Heart#cite_note-2)
 - Most of the current heart names are the same as the names of one of the tracks in the chapter in A- and B-Sides. Namely, the track that the B-Side remixes is the track the A-Side heart is named after, and the B-Side heart is named after the mix's name. The only exceptions to this are 1A, 4A and 7A.

# Forsaken City C-Side

[Sign in to edit](https://auth.fandom.com/signin?redirect=https%3A%2F%2Fcelestegame.fandom.com%2Fwiki%2FForsaken_City_C-Side%3Fveaction%3Dedit&uselang=en)
